intro: Hieracium coraxostylum, commonly known as the black-footed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy habitats and features dark green, serrated leaves. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster, attracting various pollinators. Hieracium coraxostylum is known for its robust growth and adaptability to different soil conditions.
